conclusion: Shadows change based on the position of the light source relative to the objects casting them.
The light source is positioned to the left of the objects in the initial scenario, and shadows A, B, C, and D are cast to the right of the objects on the floor.
In the new scenario, the light source is moved to the front-right, away from the objects.
Shadow A is cast to the right of the white funnel-like object in the initial scenario.

With the light moved to the front-right, shadow A will still be cast but will likely be closer to its original position because the light source is moving further away and slightly more towards the front.
The size of shadow A could potentially decrease slightly since the light source is further away, but the front component might become more prominent due to the relative angle.
Shadow B is cast near the black object in the initial scenario.
With the light moved to the front-right, shadow B will move slightly towards its original position due to the light source moving towards the front and away from the black object.
The size of shadow B may decrease slightly since the light source is further away, which generally reduces shadow size.
Shadow C is cast to the right of the white funnel-like object in the initial scenario.
As the light source moves front-right, shadow C will shift further towards the front and possibly closer to the object due to the angle change.
The size of shadow C could decrease slightly due to the increased distance from the light source.
Shadow D is cast under the white triangular object in the initial scenario.
Considering the light source's movement, shadow D will likely move towards the front due to the angle change and the light source being more in the front-right direction.
The size of shadow D will probably decrease as the light source is further away, but the front part might become more pronounced.
Shadow A moves slightly to the right and becomes slightly smaller.
Shadow B moves slightly towards its original position and becomes slightly smaller.
Shadow C moves slightly forward and closer to the object and becomes slightly smaller.
Shadow D moves forward and becomes slightly smaller.
